cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles south of Cayo Largo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the Gulf of Mexico toward the upper Texas–south-central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast (near the TX-LA border, south of Beaumont–Port Arthur)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (storm expected to move inland north of the coast after landfall)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coast from Galveston Bay eastward through southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (gale to possibly hurricane force) likely late Wednesday night through Thursday at Beaumont–Port Arthur.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential life-threatening surge of 3–8 ft possible along the upper Texas coast including Sabine Lake and the Neches River approaches to Beaumont.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals near 12 inches possible, producing flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible as outer rain-bands move onshore.
